## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
I've been looking into the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace, and I'm wondering how it handles transactions between buyers and sellers. Does it allow for intermediaries to control these transactions?

**AI Assistant:**
Actually, the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace does the opposite. It enables transactions to be executed directly, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. This is a key feature of the marketplace, allowing for complete decentralization and self-sovereignty. There's no need for a middleman, giving buyers and sellers full control over their transactions.

**User:**
That's great to hear. I'm also interested in using Verus Vault to secure my funds. If I lock my VerusID with Vault, can I still spend funds from that identity?

**AI Assistant:**
No, you cannot spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault. Once you lock your identity with Vault, you won't be able to spend funds from that identity until it's unlocked again. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network to earn rewards.

**User:**
Okay, got it. And finally, I was wondering if I can use Verus Vault without setting up a primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID?

**AI Assistant:**
No, that's not possible. To enable revocation, recovery, and all Verus Vault capabilities, you must have one primary identity and at least one revocation/recovery ID configured. This is a necessary requirement to use Verus Vault to protect your funds.
How does the Verus ID and NFT Marketplace allow for intermediaries to control transactions between buyers and sellers?

The Verus ID and NFT Marketplace does not allow for intermediaries to control transactions between buyers and sellers. In fact, it enables transactions to be executed directly, peer-to-peer, without any intermediary necessary. This is a key feature of the marketplace, allowing for complete decentralization and self-sovereignty.

### Verus ID and NFT Marketplace
Buy and sell VerusIDs on-chain, advertising your offer directly to the owner of an ID or NFT, or posting the sale of your NFT on the worldwide blockchain for all the world to see. Execute transactions in a completely decentralized way. Pay or offer to pay from a transparent or zero-knowledge private address, still auditable by you. Accept payment to either as well, and best of all, execute your transactions directly, peer-to-peer without any intermediary necessary. Don’t worry the on-chain model still makes room for owners to select and share proceeds with value added agents, marketing organizations, or other participants in a new economy of provable digital ownership. It’s the next step in the evolution of VerusID, the most powerful self-sovereign identity and secure storage model for funds in the digital world.### Verus Vault
With Verus Vault you can now protect funds on a VerusID, even from theft of a private key! If you lock your VerusID with Vault you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. While locked, you can still stake those same funds on the Verus network and earn by doing so. Of course, you can also still receive funds.IT IS IMPORTANT TO NOTE THAT ENABLING REVOCATION, RECOVERY, AND ALL VERUS VAULT CAPABILITIES REQUIRE YOU TO HAVE ONE PRIMARY IDENTITY, AND AT LEAST ONE REVOCATION/RECOVERY ID CONFIGURED.
Is it possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault?

No, it is not possible to spend funds from a VerusID that has been locked with Verus Vault. If you lock your VerusID with Vault, you cannot spend funds from that identity at all until it is again unlocked. However, you can still receive funds and stake those same funds on the Verus network to earn rewards.
